actions-list.actionItem: The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk transmitted to the House sealed envelopes received from the White House on December 30, 2025, at 3:17 p.m., said to contain messages from the President on his objections to H.R. 131 and H.R. 504.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. John Kellogg, Christ Church Capitol Hill, Washington, DC.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Robert P. Bresnahan Jr. to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
